alert.note: Alert for Mississippi; New Madrid (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 8:17PM CST until March 12 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...Missouri... Mississippi River at New Madrid affecting Mississippi, New Madrid and Fulton Counties. .With runoff from recent heavy rains, the river has risen, and is cresting tonight at New Madrid. It will then drop below flood stage late Friday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at New Madrid. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 35.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting around 35.3 feet tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
